text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: To be, or not to be, that is the question.
author: William Shakespeare

text: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: That’s one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

text: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Man is condemned to be free.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Will Durant

text: May the Force be with you.
author: Star Wars

text: I’ll be back.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Why so serious?
author: The Joker

text: Life finds a way.
author: Ian Malcolm

text: You can’t handle the truth!
author: Colonel Jessup

text: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Well-behaved women seldom make history.
author: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

text: I am my own muse. I am the subject I know best.
author: Frida Kahlo

text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

text: A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it’s in hot water.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: I raise up my voice—not so I can shout, but so that those without a voice can be heard.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: When they go low, we go high.
author: Michelle Obama

text: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.
author: Marie Curie

text: Power’s not given to you. You have to take it.
author: Beyoncé Knowles

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another stepping stone to greatness.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Feminism is the radical notion that women are people.
author: Marie Shear

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
author: Helen Keller

text: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect. You should expect it.
author: Sarah Dessen

text: Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim.
author: Nora Ephron

text: Courage is like a muscle. We strengthen it by use.
author: Ruth Gordon

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

text: I don’t want other people to decide who I am. I want to decide that for myself.
author: Emma Watson

text: You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through.
author: Rosalynn Carter

text: If you’re always trying to be normal, you will never know how amazing you can be.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The question isn’t who’s going to let me; it’s who’s going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Don’t compromise yourself. You’re all you’ve got.
author: Janis Joplin

text: I am not free while any woman is unfree, even when her shackles are very different from my own.
author: Audre Lorde

text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
author: Elon Musk

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Reality is created by the mind, we can change our reality by changing our mind.
author: Plato

text: If I cannot do great things, I can do small things in a great way.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead
